attributes.action: Same sex couple can be placed on birth certificate
attributes.additional_details: If an insemination has resulted in the birth of child, and both people consent to be parents, in a same sex couple, they both should be able to be on the birth certificate without marriage/civil partnership, without a parental agreement or adoption. Same sex couples should have the same rights as heterosexual couples.
attributes.background: Same sex couples able to go on a birth certificate without marriage/civil partnership, when not inseminated at a clinic.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/601909

If you want to see specific changes to rules for who can be registered on a birth certificate for same-sex female couples, we could accept a petition about this. Please contact us at petitionscommittee@parliament.uk if you'd like help drafting a new petition.
